content.description: Start at the saddle and free climb up and right to a ledge.  Thin stoppers or Ball-nuts will fit here in the thin seam at your chest or just place hand sized cams high in the horizontal.   Continue straight up, aiding on questionable rock.  After a few good cams free and aid up soft rock to a ledge.  Place a big cam or two in the bedding seam and mantel onto the ledge.  Clip 3 bolts to the summit.
content.protection:
-Double set of cams from small to .75 camalot

-Single #1-5, optional 6.

-Small to med. off set cams might be nice.

-Stoppers(surprisingly useful)

-Draws/runners

-60m rope

-Anchor has chain so no tat needed.
content.location: From the vehicle choose the path of least resistance many cow/game trails exist.  The route is mostly on the west side but start on the north side at the saddle.
